title: Dutch NIBC bank shares priced at 8.75 euros in initial public offering
text: March 22, 2018 / 9:23 PM / Updated an hour ago Dutch NIBC bank shares priced at 8.75 euros in initial public offering Reuters Staff 1 Min Read AMSTERDAM, March 22 (Reuters) - The Dutch bank NIBC said on Thursday it had priced shares at 8.75 euros ($10.77) in its initial public offering, at the bottom of an indicated range of 8.75-10.25 euros. The price values the bank’s equity at 1.28 billion euros. CEO Paulus de Wilt said in a statement the offering had strong retail demand “despite heightened market volatility in recent days”. Owner JC Flowers will sell a 25 percent stake in the bank, raising 320 million euros. The bank is known as a mortgage broker and lender to small and medium-sized corporate borrowers in the Netherlands, Germany, Britain and Belgium. Shares are set to begin trading on Friday. ($1 = 0.8127 euros) (Reporting by Toby Sterling; Editing by Kevin Liffey)
